title: Stardew Valley: What Does "Favorite Thing" Mean + Some Fun Easter Eggs

steps.title: You can enter a "favorite thing" when creating a new Stardew Valley character.
steps.content: You can enter a "favorite thing" when creating a new Stardew Valley character. This is one of the options in the character creator, and the game allows you to type anything you want in the text field. [1] X Research source

steps.title: When you eat a Stardrop, you will get flavor text about your favorite thing.
steps.content: When you eat a Stardrop, you will get flavor text about your favorite thing. A Stardrop is a rare consumable you can get that increases your maximum energy. When you eat a Stardrop, the game will say "Your mind is filled with thoughts of [favorite thing]" or "It's strange, but the taste reminds of you [favorite thing]". [2] X Research source You can get Stardrops from the following places: For 2,000 stars at the Stardew Valley Fair From a chest on floor 100 of the Mines From a spouse or roommate when your friendship reaches 12.5 stars Sold for 20,000 gold from Krobus in the Sewers From Old Master Cannoli in the Secret Woods after giving him a Sweet Gem Berry In a letter from Willy after getting the Master Angler Achievement As a reward for donating all 95 items to the Museum

steps.title: Your favorite thing has no gameplay advantage or disadvantage.
steps.content: Your favorite thing has no gameplay advantage or disadvantage. It's just a fun way to add a personalized touch when you find the rare Stardrop item. [3] X Research source However, you can get some special messages if you enter specific words as your favorite thing.

steps.title: Set your favorite thing as "ConcernedApe."
steps.content: Set your favorite thing as "ConcernedApe." ConcernedApe is the developer of Stardew Valley . If you set your favorite thing as ConcernedApe, you will get a special message when you eat a Stardrop saying "thank you." [4] X Research source

steps.title: Set your favorite thing as "Stardew."
steps.content: Set your favorite thing as "Stardew." If you set your favorite thing as the name of the game itself, you will get a special message when you eat a Stardrop that mentions you are connected to the valley. [5] X Research source Note that you must capitalize the word "Stardew" to get this special message.
